column2: (of something unpleasant or severe) become less severe or intense; the storm suddenly abated
deviating from the norm/noun form is aberration; this aberrant behaviour requires explaination
to depart clandestinely or leave hurriedly secretly typically to escape custody or arrest;the barman abscondedwith a week's takings

excessive admiration or praise/ intense adoration; he found it difficult to cope with the adulation of fans
concerned with beauty or appreciation of the beauty; the pictures give great aesthetic pleasure
eager and enthusiastic readiness/brisk and cheerful readiness;sted the invitation with alacrity
make (somehthing bad or unsatisfactory) better or tolerable; the reform did much to ameliorate the standards
deviating from the normal  order  law etc; gravitational anomaly
deviating from the normal  order  law etc; gravitational anomaly
indiffernce or lack of interest
an expressionof approval or praise; FORMAL  a term of approbation
strenous or taxing or requiring great effort; an arduous journey
one who practices in rigid self-denial esp as an act of religion;
to ease or lessen/to appease or pacify;the letter assuaged the fears of most members
daring or fearless/ recklessly bold/ showing an impudent lack of respect; a series of audacious take overs/he made an audacious remark
without adornment/severly simple/ ascetic/ Also could mean severe or strict in attitude or manner
extreme greed for wealth or material gain; the corporate worlued by avarice and a thirst for power
a universallrecogned principle;
self-evident or unquestionable; it is axiomatic that dividend has to be financed
related to countryside andf country life esp pleasent aspects of it; the church is lovely for its bucolic setting
to grow rapidly or flourish;
dissonance/discordance/ harsh discordant mixture of sounds; a cacophony of deafening alarm bells
an established set of principles or code or laws often religious in nature; the appointment violated canons
following or in agreement of the traditional standards/ according to recognized rules or scientific laws; teh canonical rites of roman church
erratic/fickle/sudden changes in behaviour; a capricious and brutal administration
severe criticism or punishment; he was castigated for not setting a good example/reprimand/rebuke/
the hero's speech acted as a catalyst for debate
burning or stinging/causing corrosion/sarcastic in a scathing and bitter way; a caustic cleaner/they were making caustic commenst about the referee
to express severe disapproval or to criticize severely in a formal statement or to officially rebuke; the company was heavily censured by the inspectors of tax department
wary or cautious or suspiciously reluctant to to do something; she had been chary of telling the whole truth
trikery or subterfuge in order to achieve one's goal; storylines packed with political chicanery
clear  logical and convincing; they put forward cogent arguments for british membership
willingness to comply with wishes of others wihout protest;
an expert in matters of taste; a connoisseur in matters of taste
argumentative/quarrelsome/causing controversy or disagreement; there was a contentious debate over the use of genetically modified crops/the news channels these days can make any thing contentious
regretful/penitent/repentant/seeking forgiveness; a contrite tone
complex or complicated;the film is let down by a convoluted plot
deserving blame; mercy killings are less culpable than ordinary murders
a scarcity or lack of something; there is a dearth of evidence
to question or to oppose or to show reluctance; she demurred when presented the challenge
intended to teach or instruct esp having a moral instruction as an ulterior motive; the didactic novel set out to expose the moral injustic
to undeceive or to set right or persuade someone that an idea or belief is mistaken; he quickly disabused me of the fanciful notions
conflicting/dissonant or harsh in sound; discordant qualities/discordant chanting
cautious reserve in speech or ability to make resposible decisions; she could rely on his discretion/local authorities should use their discretion in setting the charges
impartial or free of bias or self interest/not interested; a banker is supposed to give a disinterested advice; her drunkard father was very disinterested in her career
fundamentally different or not able to compare; they inhabit disparate words of thought
expressing a rigid opinion based on unproved or improavblr principles.. dogma; she was not tempted to be dogmatic about what she believed
quality of being cheerful and full of energy/exuberence; the ebullience of happy children
deriving ideas  style  taste from a broad and diverse range of sources; universities offering a eclectic mix of courses
extreme boldness/presumptiousness or arrogant behaviour; one junior had the effrontery to challenge the coroner's decision
a poem of serious reflection typically a lament for the dead;
well-spoken or expressive or articulate; an eloquent speech or the bus journey is eloquent of the class inequality
soothing to skin/making less harsh or mollifying or trying to avoid confrontation; a emolient body wash/president's emollient approach to the differences
based on observation and experiments
to weaken or reduce in vitality; enervating heat
mysterious/bscure/tough to understand.. derived from enigma; he took the money with an enigmatic smile
a feeling of restlessness and dissatisfation because of lack of occupation or boredom or apathy; he succumbed to ennui and despair
brief/ lasting for a short time; fashions are ephemeral
to use ambiguos language with a deceptive intent; the government have equivocated too often in the past
very learned/scholarly; ken could turn any conversation into an erudite discussion
intended or likely to be understood by a small group of people with a specialized knowledge or interest; esoteric philosophical debates
a speech or piece of writing that praises someone or something highly  especially a tribute to some who died; a eulogy to the queen mother
exonerate or show that someone is not guilty of wrongdoing or to clear of blame; the article exculpated the mayor
urgent or pressing or require immediate action ro attention; the exigent demand of her contemporaries' music took a toll on her voice
to remove the blame;
spoken or done without preparation or improvised; an extemporaneous speech
humourous/ treating serious issues with deliberately inappropriate humour or flippant; a facetious remark
an invalid or incorrect notion/ a mistaken belief; the notion that camera never lies is a fallacy
obstruction especially using prolonged speech to delay legislative action or delay the progress;
express vehement protest or to loudly attack; all fulminated against the new curriculum
secretive typically because it might lead to trouble or guilty or surreptitious; we exchanged furtive smiles across the tables
extrovert or sociable or outgoing or enjoying the xompany of other people; he was popular and a gregarious man
a long aggressive or pompous speech/ to deliver a long pompous or aggressive speech;
violating accepted dogma or convention .. heresy
an exaggerated statement; he vowed revenge with oaths and hyperboles
lacking funds or without money; a titled but impecunious family
beginning to happen or develop or become apparent; he could feel the incipient anger building up
unmoving/lethargic/sluggish; she lay inert in her bed/an inert political system
artless/frank and candid/innocent and unsuspecting; he eyed her with wide  ingenuous eyes/ also could mean childlike
harmless or causing no damage; it was an innocuous question
accustomed to something esp. unplesant; these children have been inured to violence
having or showing a tendency to be easily angered; an irascible and difficult man
to praise highly; the obituary lauded him as a great soldier
expressed clearly or easily understood; a lucid account
the quality of being generously noble in mind and heart esp in forgiving; both sides will have to show mangnanimity
related to war or fighting; martial bravery
lacking interest or excitent or ordinary/of this earthly word rather than a heavenly one; his mundane existence/dead can act upon the mundane world
just coming into existence/in early development stages; nascent space organization
vague or ill-defined/in form of cloud or hazy; nebulous concepts like life/a giant nebulous glow
a new word expression  usage;
poisonous; noxious fumes
lacing sharpness of intellect or stupid/not sharp-pointed or blunt; the guy was deliberately being obtuse
avoid or prevent or to anticipate and make unnecesarty; parachute can be used to obviate the disaster
(of task and resposibilities) involving a great deal of effort  trouble  difficulty; he found his duties increasingly onerous
a song of praise or triupmh; a paean of praise for the poets
a humourous imitattion intended for ridicule esp. in literature and arts;
recurrent throughout the year or for many years/happening repeatedly; perennial river
treachery/intentional breach of faith; it was an example of his perfidy
cursory or done without real interest (of action); he gave a perfunctory nod
acutely perceptive/having keen discernment/ having a readu insight inot and nderstanding of things/ it implies unsual power to comprehend what is puzzling or hidden
to babble meaninglessly; she began to prattle on about her visit to dentist

verb=cause an event or a situation which is usually undersiable to happen suddenly  unexpectedly or prematurely/adj=done made or acting suddenly or without careful consideration; the incident precipitated a political crisis/apologies for my staff-their actions were precipitate
preference or a disposition in favour fo something; your predilection for pretty girls
that fact of knowing something in advance; with extraordinary prescience  jung predicted the nazi eruption
to deliberately avoid the truth/speak or act in an evasive way/ to mislead; he seemed to prevaricate when journalists asked some questions
misgivings/reservations/causes for hesitancy/an uneasy feeling of doubt or worry or fear esp about one's own conduct; The military regimes usually have no qualms about controlling the press
to retract esp a previously held belief; The brutal dictator will behead anyone who refuse to recant their critisims of his rule
prove a statement or a theory to be false/to succesfully argue against/disprove; These claioms have not been sucessfully refuted
to forcibly assign esp to a lower place or position/assign an inferior rank or position to; they aim to prevent women from bein relegated to secondary rule
reserved/quite/reluctant to express one's thghts and feelings; she was extremely reticent about her personal affairs
concerned and attentive/eager; she was always solicitus about the welfare of her students

aoursing moral distaste and contempt or involving immoral and dishonourable actions and motives/dirty or squalid or filthy ; theo story paintys a sordid picture of bribes and scams/the overcrowded housing conditions were sordid and degrading
occuring at irregular intervals or only in few places/scattered or isolated; sporadic fighting broke out
to waste esp money or time in a recless irresponsible manner; taxpayer's money was squandered on adminestering the tax
not moving or active or motion/at rest;

to stun baffle or amaze/ make someone unable to think or feel properly; administering drugs to women with intent to stupefy her/ the amount of money spent by them  on clothes will stupefy their grandparents
block or thwart or hinder the progress of; the changes should ot be allowed to stymie the new medical treatments
combinations of parts to make a whole
force that causes rotation
winding twisiting excessively complicated ; the route is tortuous/a tourtuous argument
eager or quick to argue or fight/agressively defiant; the truculent attitude of farmers to cheaper imports
showing strong feeling/passionate or intense; her voice was low but vehement
confirming to facts and accuracy/truthfulness or honesty; officials were concerned about veracity of the story
extremely harmful or posinous/ bitterly hostile or antagonistic; a virulent strain or influenza/a virulent attack on liberalism
having an insatiable apetite for an activity or pursuit/extremely hungry or ravenous; a voracious reader/ a voracious apetite
to move to and fro/ to be unsettled in opinion; the flame wavered in the draught/ his love for her never wavered
